ABC_a_c.ABC_a_cDef: This categorizes products based on their impact on cost. Products in Class A contribute to the majority of costs, so you should prioritize them. Class B products are more infrequently bought. Class C items are not high value and do not need many follow-ups.

bin_l.bin_lDef: A location that designates a particular shelf, pallet position, or bin within a given zone in a given depot. For example, within Zone A, you may have a bin location for pharmacy items.

bud_c.bud_cDef: A sequence of alphanumeric digits assigned by organizations for budgetary reporting. Budget codes identify fund types and track expenditures.

cen_p.cen_pDef: When, for example, a headquarters office purchases stock for delivery to all its subsidiaries. Allows the user to see and create purchase orders destined for multiple locations.

com_i.com_iDef: Inventory becomes committed when the user picks inventory on the Create Outbound Shipment page.

con.conDef: All of the stock sent out from your warehouse over a given time period.

dis_w_p.dis_w_pDef: These locations are essentially interchangeable and exist only to receive stock from depots. Any location to which you will be sending stock, but not actively receiving or managing inventory in Openboxes, is a ward, dispensary, or pharmacy.
dis_w_p.html: See also Location Type and Supported Activities.

ele_s_c.ele_s_cDef: Like a paper stock card, this provides the user with key product details and the history of transactions related to that product.

for_c.for_cDef: An optional system that lets users list and group all products for a certain location or service.

GL_a.GL_aDef: Also known as general ledger accounts, these account numbers are used to categorize types of financial transactions. For example, you could create a GL account for medical supplies, food, or IT equipment.

hol_b.hol_bDef: Holds products that eed to be isolated or prevented from being picked or shipped. For example, if you receive information from a supplier that a product lot number is being investigated and may be recalled, put that lot number in a hold bin.

lea_t.lea_tDef: The number of days it takes for a product to reach the site after it is ordered.

loc.locDef: A physical space that ships stock, receives stock, or manages inventory.

loc_g.loc_gDef: A flexible method of grouping often used to represent a particular geographic area.

loc_n.loc_nDef: A unique code that identifies your location, such as an acronym. If left blank, OpenBoxes auto-generates this code.

man_c.mac_cDef: The code/SKU the manufacturer uses for the product.

man_n.man_nDef: The name the manufacturer calls the product (NOT the name of the manufacturer).

org.orgDef: A company, government, or other entity that interacts directly or indirectly with OpenBoxes. The organization represents the financial entity and is associated with one or more locations which represent a physical office or warehouse.

par_r.par_rDef: A stratagem that allows users to receive part of a shipment at first, then return later to receive the rest of the shipment.

par.parDef: People, users, organizations, or locations that interact with OpenBoxes. This interaction can be active, like a user that logs into the system to do work, or passive, like an organization that is referenced in certain fields but does actively engage with the system.

peo.peoDef: People (or Persons in singular form) are non-users that need to be referenced in the system or receive emails notifying them of transactions you specify.

PiH.PiHDef: Partners In Health, OpenBoxes's parent organization

pro.proDef: A specific physical item tracked in various transactions in OpenBoxes, such as a purchase order, shipment, and inventory. Each product has a unique auto-generated code.

pro_a.pro_aDef: Custom fields that can be added to a product to record information that is not in the standard product card. For example, a custom "temperature requirements" free-text field under "cold chain" to further specify product needs.

pro_c.pro_cDef: Called a SKU in some systems, this code is the main identifier for the product in all areas of the system. For example, TS123.

pro_f.pro_fDef: A way of grouping similar products. For example, all nasogastric feeding tubes could belong to the same product family.
pro_f.html: See also View and Create Product Family.

pro_r.pro_rDef: Describes a specific physical item to track in inventory, shipments, and purchase orders. Made up of first a product code, then a product name. For example: "TS123 - Exam Gloves".

pul_r.pul_rDef: A plan that autofills quantities for each item in the stocklist by looking at the quantity on hand at the destination and demand of the products. The max quantity will be demand of the product.

pus_r.pus_rDef: A plan that involves creations or ordering inventory stock based on predictions of customer demand and ordering. Allows users to enter max quantity for each item.

qua_a.qua_aDef: The uncommitted portion of the inventory. To determine this number, take the quantity on hand and subtract any product that's on hold, already picked for other stock movements/stock transfers, or otherwise committed and canâ€™t be acted upon.
qua_a.html: See also Outbound Shipment - page by page.

qua_o_h.qua_o_hDef: The total quantity in inventory at a given location. This encompasses all products including lots or quantities that are on hold, allocated to requisitions, or committed in some other fashion.
qua_o_h.html: See also Outbound Shipment - page by page.

rec.recDef: Non-users in OpenBoxes that need to be referenced in the system or receive emails notifying them of certain transactions.

rep_p.rep_pDef: This is how many days between when you order the product and it arrives.

sou_c.sou_cDef: A unique combination of supplier code, manufacturer, and manufacturer code.

sto.stoDef: A list of products that are frequently requested from a requesting facility.
sto.html: See also Intro to Stocklists (Admin) or Intro to Stocklists (User).

sup.supDef: A location that exists only to send stock to other locations. Any location that sends stock but does not manage stock in Openboxes can also be a supplier; for example, Amazon.

syn.synDef: Usually a translated product name. For example, if a user in a Spanish locale creates the product "Bomba de jeringa, elÃ©ctrica", they could add the English synonym "Syringe Pump, Electric" so their English-speaking users could read it.

tag.tagDef: Free-text sets of descriptors that can be applied to a set of products for easier grouping.

UNS.UNSDef: United Nations Standard Products and Services Code

ven_c.ven_cDef: The code/SKU the vendor uses for the product.

ven_n.ven_nDef: The name the vendor calls the product (NOT the name of the vendor).

zon_l.zon_lDef: An area or a room within a warehouse that contains multiple bins. For example, in a warehouse with a separate cold room, the zone for cold chain items might be "Cold Room 1", and within that room, each bin might represent a shelf.
zon_l.html: See also Managing Bin and Zone Locations.
